examples.note: Example sentence using the word in a sentence.

etymology.value: From Old Irish sciath (“shield”), from Proto-Celtic *skētos (“shield”), from Proto-Indo-European *(s)kʷeyt- (“to cover, protect”).

usage_notes.explanation: This word is primarily found in historical texts and literature related to Old Irish. It is not commonly used in modern Irish.

readability_explanation.text: This word is highly specialized, primarily appearing in historical or linguistic contexts related to Old Irish. It is not part of common modern vocabulary. Understanding requires knowledge of Old Irish or Celtic studies.

example_sentences.sentence: Bhí sciath mhaith ag an laoch.
example_sentences.translation: The hero had a good shield.
